attributes.action: Scrap the expansion plans for Heathrow Airport
attributes.background: More expansion for London, which the residents don't want. More pollution, years of misery on the M25, and wasting taxpayer money in an outdated hub-and-spoke airport operating model. The rest of the UK would love the chance to expand their infrastructure.
attributes.additional_details: East Midlands Airport in Leicestershire is the absolute logical choice for expanding the UK's network. It's got a HUGE runway (already handles 747s, A380s and An-124s), it's right next to the M42 (for M6) and M1, and it's on the route of HS2. If it has to be in London, then Gatwick is by far a more sensible option when you consider disruption, pollution, and cost.

attributes.action: Ban plastic fishing nets as they make 46% of the plastic waste in the ocean.
attributes.background: Recently in the uk and across the globe, plastic straws are being banned from many restraunts. But did you know that that straws make up under 1% of ocean waste, but fishing nets make up a huge 46%. So instead of discriminating special needs people who need straws to drink ban fishing nets!

attributes.action: Recognise parental  alienation and make it a criminal offence.
attributes.background:
Parental Alienation
This can occur when a child is caught in between their parents divorce or separation, the offending parent deliberately turns their child against their ex so that they eventually cut off all contact. This can be described as one parent ‘trying to turn their child into a soldier.
attributes.additional_details: Anthony Douglas, the chief executive of Cafcass, vividly described it as one parent ‘trying to turn their child into a child soldier in a battle’. Previously parental alienation has been dismissed as a common product of bitterness about a failed relationship, but it is separate from these normal feelings of hurt. Parental alienation is in fact an internationally recognised form of parental psychological abuse and undermines the Universal Declaration of Human Rights and the UN Convention on the rights of the child. In Mexico and Brazil, it is even classed as a criminal offence.

attributes.action: Legalise a new class of light electric vehicles
attributes.background: Living in a big city, getting around is a major consideration. Public transport is overcrowded, dirty and often inconvenient. Private vehicles are unaffordable and inconvenient. As the UK invests in infrastructure for the alternative, cycling, PEVs which could utilise this continue to be outlawed.
attributes.additional_details:
As many other countries already do, the UK should embrace the existence of Personal Electric Vehicles (PEVs).

These are small electrically propelled vehicles such as scooters which reach similar speeds to a bicycle with a range of around 20 miles, and unlike bikes are practical enough to be handled like a suitcase when not in use.

With similar regards to electric bikes, legalising PEVs will offer an added green alternative for transportation and allow individuals improved freedom of movement.

attributes.action: Make first aid&basic life support a legal requirement for junior school children
attributes.background: A large percentage of accidents and emergencies occur in a household. The vast majority of these incidents that occur have a child present on scene. Many of these children present have no understanding and practical knowledge of basic first aid which could be pivotal in saving a life or limb.
attributes.additional_details: The aim of this scheme is to introduce and educate children in junior year groups 5 and 6 how to manage minor injuries such as burns and lacerations. Also covered within these workshops, children will learn how to recognise when someone is in cardiac arrest and how to perform BASIC life support until suitable help arrives.

attributes.action: The Saudi Arabian Ambassador should be expelled.
attributes.background: The Saudi armed forces are attacking Yemen with bad reconnaissance. The result is the large scale killing of innocent civilians. The Saudi authorities permit this situation to perpetuate.
attributes.additional_details: At least 29 children have been killed and 30 wounded in a Saudi-led coalition air strike in Yemen, the International Committee of the Red Cross says. The children were travelling on a bus that was hit at a market in Dahyan, in the northern province of Saada. The health ministry run by the rebel Houthi movement put the death toll at 43, and said 61 people were wounded. The coalition, which is backing Yemen's government in a war with the Houthis, said its actions were "legitimate".

attributes.action: To impose stricter laws for the use of horse drawn carts, and roadside tethering
attributes.background: The use of horse drawn carts is now widely known for severe health implications on the horse, as well as potentially dangerous to other traffic as roads get busier. Also Welfare of horses tethered to roadsides often with no shelter and minimal food, should be further considered by the government.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.nyclass.org/horse_drawn_carriages (a charity dedicated to the welfare of horses carrying carriages).                             -https://www.google.co.uk/amp/s/www.loughboroughecho.net/news/local-news/video-man-filmed-riding-horse-12702592.amp.
-https://www.bbc.com/news/uk-england-york-north-yorkshire-29310503.
- M.Homer et al. 2007. X-ray alterations on spinal processes of 295 warmblood horses without clinical findings. Pferdeheilkunde 23 journal. Sep/Oct 507-511

attributes.action: Ban any planning/ development on green belt, even in 'exceptional circumstances'
attributes.background: Successive Gts have failed to plan for UK future housing need. Local (housing) plans require local authorities to plan for future housing plans in that area. Authorities are offered huge financial incentives. Gmt targets are unrealistic and 220,000+ homes are currently planned for the green belt.
attributes.additional_details:
12.4% of UK is GB.
Landowners offered ££ to sell. 
Gmt housing targets fantasy, touting need for 'affordable housing', (80% of current market rent). LA's offered ££ to overbuild through 'new'/ 'affordable' homes bonuses. 
30m people live around GB. 30,000km of public rights of way. 250kha quality agricultural land. 89000ha SSSI.
220000ha mixed woodland. 
We say:
Review new homes targets. 
Brownfield not green belt.
No new homes bonuses.
Cease all current/ future plans to develop the green belt.

attributes.action: Ban processed meat adverts in the UK
attributes.background: Processed meat has been classified as carcinogenic to humans by the WHO. As little as one serving a day increases the risk of diabetes by 50% and heart disease by 42% (guardian) and causes 8,500 cancers every year. Advertisements of it should be banned completely.
attributes.additional_details:
Processed meat was now in a group of 120 proven carcinogens, alongside alcohol, asbestos and tobacco.
The WHO advised that consuming 50g of processed meat a day – equivalent to just a couple of rashers of bacon or one hotdog – would raise the risk of getting bowel cancer by 18% over a lifetime. The consumption of processed meat causes an additional 34,000 worldwide cancer deaths a year,  four times the number of people killed annually on Britain’s roads.
Consuming just 9g of bacon a day – less than a rasher – could significantly raise the risk of developing breast cancer later in life. Jill Pell from Glasgow University says that “it would be misleading” for health authorities to set any safe dose for processed meat “other than zero”. The Guardian.

attributes.action: Take no military action in Syria using UK forces or weapons.
attributes.background: The cost of such action cannot be justified if public money is not currently  available to support vital health, social welfare, policing, ambulance, education and local authority services in our country.

attributes.action: Expel Israeli Ambassador, after attacks on the State of Palestine.
attributes.background: Demonstrations by Palestinians against Trump's declaration of Jerusalem as capital of Israel were met with violence by Israeli soldiers who shot and killed demonstrators and arrested children.

attributes.action: Create a UK wide waste and recycling system.
attributes.background: The current waste and recycling system is broken down into counties or smaller regions of the country which are able to recycle different products, have different coloured signage, and for the most part a complete lack of public reycling facilities.We could be recycling more and not adding confusion
attributes.additional_details: The UK Government has said it will reduce plastic waste and increase recycling rates. This coupled with China no longer taking plastic waste means that more needs to be done to recycle items in this country. Currently councils are only able to recycle certain items meaning that a lot of recycling across the country actually ends up in landfil/waste to energy.We need one system for the whole country so that no matter where you are it is clear which bin an item should go in and it will be recycled

attributes.action: DEFRA support Farmers Transitioning to Arable Farming
attributes.background: To help and support Farmers Transitioning from Animal Agriculture to Arable Farming

attributes.action: Demand a public inquiry into South Western Railway under MD Andy Mellors
attributes.background: As a commuter and regular user of South Western Railway I need answers from Westminster as to why privatized companies such as this can get away with such an increasingly appalling service!
attributes.additional_details:
Broken down train at Clapham Jct
on eve of 19/6/18 causing delays of over an hour to most of South East!
General daily failure of trains to leave at published times.

attributes.action: Require large employers to publish their parental leave and pay policies
attributes.background: There is already a requirement that companies have such policies (which may match the statutory minimum). However, this information is not generally publicly available and often is not shared with potential employees. Sadly, individuals risk discrimination if they ask for it.
attributes.additional_details:
In 2014 Glassdoor found that 78% of women would not ask about maternity policies at interview, and only 1/3 of them received this information in induction packs. Yet salary, holiday, pension entitlements and health insurance are all routinely discussed at the point of hiring.

These policies could be included with gender pay gap reporting for large companies. This would be logistically easy for companies to do. We call upon the government to adopt this position.

attributes.action: Ban schools from supplying milk cartons with plastic straws.
attributes.background: Eco teams from two primary schools in the North West are collaborating to ban plastic straws from school milk after learning about the damage they are causing to our wildlife and habitats.
attributes.additional_details: The children estimate that 1.7 million children have milk each day in Key Stage 1, so approximately 8.5 million straws are discarded each week.  The Government must ban schools from giving children milk with plastic straws, ban local authorities from buying milk with plastic straws, and ensure that all milk supplied to schools meets minimum Eco standards so that no unnecessary plastic, like straws, are used in manufacturing or packaging.

attributes.action: Encourage British Sign Language in KS1 in Schools
attributes.background:
Being a child of Deaf  Parents I am deeply passionate about having Sign Language involved in Schools.
With a population of 11 million Chilren Deaf or Hearing impaired in our Country I feel it would be of huge benefit to teach Sign language at a young age..
attributes.additional_details:
With alot of deaf Schools closing and Deaf Hearing impaired Children now being taught in mainsteam Schools with Classroom support.
Socially they are being affected..
Its a lonely place for Deaf Children Socially.
With a huge shortage of interpreters and some Deaf adults having to wait almost a week for support. I feel Children will enjoy sign language enough to encourage them to feel as passionate as myself and gain qualifications.
Lets make a bridge bring hearing and deaf together.

attributes.action: Require the prominent labelling of palm oil on all products sold in the UK
attributes.background: Palm oil plantations are a major reason of huge tracts of rainforest destroyed every day. Endangered species are being pushed towards extinction. Companies know that Palm oil is becoming well known as a problem ingredient and hide the product under dozens of different names making it hard to avoid.
attributes.additional_details: www.travelfordifference.com/list-palm-oil-free-products/

attributes.action: Less burden of proof for post war commonwealth citizens seeking  naturalisation
attributes.background: Commonwealth citizens who were invited to relocate during the UK's recruitment drive are now in their retirement years facing deportation. They entered the UK legally to help build post war Britain & have paid taxes in the UK. They are now discovering naturalisation was necessary but never happened.
attributes.additional_details: The 1971 Immigration Act gave people already settled in Britain Indefinite leave to Remain. These children are now adults and most are struggling to gather enough documents to convince the Home Office that they arrived before the cut off point. Some are being taken to Immigration Removal Centres, refused cancer treatment, becoming homeless and dismissed from their place of work as well as being refused any recourse to public funds which they have paid into for the past 50 plus years.

attributes.action: Change the rules on accessibility to schools to match that of planning.
attributes.background: Planning applications are judged as being accessible when within a walking distance of 2km and cycling distance of 5km to amenities.  The rules for school children should match this.  This should mean safe cycle routes for a significant amount of the current 3 mile walking distance.
attributes.additional_details:
To walk 3miles takes about an hour, whilst cycling this distance would take about 20 minutes. This reduces the amount of time children have at home to study or attend extra curricular activities.
If walking upto 2km for adults is suitable then how can the government justify the 3miles(5km) for children as young as 11?
We would like the rules changed so that those traveling upto 3 miles will have a safe cycle route most of the distance and be able to travel with a cycle the rest of the way.

attributes.action: Do not rename the Second Severn Crossing as 'The Prince Of Wales Bridge'.
attributes.background: Many are unhappy that the bridge is to be named after The Prince Of Wales. This decision was made without any consultation with the Welsh people. A name of real significance to the Welsh should be chosen.

attributes.action: Make Daventry District Council (DDC) into a Unitary Authority
attributes.background: Under the proposed arrangements, decisions in the District will be taken by a council of which a majority of members represent the urban areas of Northampton. Let DDC become a unitary authority: keep democracy local.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/northamptonshire-county-council-best-value-inspection

"Sajid Javid orders probe into country council's finances" - BBC 9 January 2018

"Tory authority becomes first UK council in 20 years to impose emergency spending ban" - Daily Telegraph 3 February 2018

"Northamptonshire County Council backs £40m budget cuts" - BBC 28 February 2018

"Auditor criticises Northants County Council in damming new report" - Northants Telegraph 22 May 2018

attributes.action: We want a public enquiry into whether children are needlessly taken into care
attributes.background: More and more children are being removed from families by social services. Applications to take children into care are at record levels. We need a public enquiry to look at why this is happening and whether children are being needlessly removed from their families.

attributes.action: Pressure Kingdom of Saudi Arabia not to execute a female civil right activist.
attributes.background: Israa Al-Ghomgham is an activist who participated in and documented the mass protests that have taken place in Qatif province in Saudi Arabia since 2011. She is currently facing the death penalty and is due to be beheaded by a public prosecutor of the KSA.
attributes.additional_details:
Saudi Arabia is taking the rare step of seeking the death penalty for a 29-year-old female activist accused of encouraging demonstrations for greater rights for the Shiite Muslim minority, the advocacy group Human Rights Watch said. 
Beheading Ms Israa Ghomgham for conducting peaceful protest is a barbaric act that violates both British and Universal values of basic human rights. We demand that the British Government put maximum pressure on the KSA to stop this barbaric act.

attributes.action: Abolish the 'Tampon Tax' once the UK has left the European Union.
attributes.background: The 'Tampon Tax' is currently at the lowest rate possible under EU's VAT rules. Once the UK has left the EU, there is an opportunity for the Government to abolish the 'Tampon Tax', therefore taking a step towards eradicating period poverty.
attributes.additional_details:
In 2017, Plan International UK found that 1 in 10 girls or women aged 14 to 21 in Britain cannot afford sanitary towels or tampons.
Period Poverty is a massive issue in the UK, and abolishing the 'Tampon Tax' would help to reduce the number of women and girls affected by it. Girls should not be missing school or using unsanitary items such as socks, tissue or newspaper, to avoid bleeding through their clothes.

attributes.action: Change employment law so that jobs cannot be described as full or part time
attributes.background: Currently employers advertise roles as full or part-time. Therefore automatically millions of potentially qualified people are excluded from applying. Removing this would mean applicants were selected for interview based on ability not availability in the first instance.
attributes.additional_details: Less than 10% of all jobs in the UK are advertised as open to any kind of flexibility. And yet most companies are actually set up to offer a range of flexible options. With the gig economy and technology supporting flexible working, the UK could actually be a world leader in flexible working but 90% of qualified candidates don't ever get to have the conversation with an employer because jobs are classified as Full time. The change would open a dialogue and lead to more employment.

attributes.action: Give people accused of sexual offences anonymity until charge.
attributes.background: No one suggests names should never be released. What I believe is that there is a correct time to release names and that is not before a person is charged with an offence.

attributes.action: Free NHS prescriptions for sickle cell anaemia patients
attributes.background: Incurable disease, it is a chronic blood disorder

attributes.action: Grant Bees legal protection under The Animal Welfare Act 2006.
attributes.background: We have over 250 species of Bee in the UK, all playing a role in our eco-system, food chain and agricultural success. Since the 1980's the Bee population has declined, which, if left to continue will have an untold impact on the mental, physical and economical welfare of everyone in the UK.
attributes.additional_details:
Under the Animal Welfare Act 2006 an animal is only granted legal protection if it is a Vertebrate. This leaves Bees with very little in the way of physical or environmental protection.
Classing Bees as a species to be protected under the AWA 2006, means better action against those who threaten the population, whether they be individuals or industries, in the long term providing a better quality of life for us as a species, as well as the numerous native species we share our country with.

attributes.action: Minimum of 1 England cricket Test match to be on free-to-air TV per year
attributes.background: Cricket participation levels in the United Kingdom are decreasing every year across all age groups (http://bit.ly/2MmseSJ) and this can be linked to the move in 2005 to show all England internationals exclusively on Sky Sports. It's time Test cricket was protected by Ofcom.
attributes.additional_details:
The ECB have recently dedicated to showing 2 T20 England Internationals a year from 2020 (https://ind.pn/2LUb4iV). 

However, this is not enough. It is time that some England Test matches are added to Category A of the "Ofcom Code on Sports and Other Listed and Designated Events" (https://wiki.sh/zehw) with a focus placed on Australia matches during an Ashes series.

attributes.action: Get Student Finance England to consider a mortgage as ‘financial independence’.
attributes.background: Currently, the regulations for an individual applying for Student Finance under the age of 25, must be assessed on their parental household income, unless married or care for a child. However, SFE do not view a mortgage to be an eligble factor to verify “independent status”.
attributes.additional_details: After several appeals to review my circumstances, SFE have rejected my request for “independent status”. As a home-owner, unemployment with little student loan to pay my mortgage for the year whilst studying, has resulted in withdrawal from my course. It is suggested to marry to be considered as “financially independent” to therefore receive finance based on my own income rather than my parents. It is an outdated system to consider marriage as more financially independent, than owning a home.

attributes.action: Legislate to give wheelchair users priority access to bus wheelchair spaces
attributes.background:
Wheelchair users do not have lawful priority over other passengers for access to designated wheelchair spaces/bays on public buses.

There have been frequent and media reported cases of such persons being able to travel as other passengers refused to move. Legislation is required to address this.
attributes.additional_details:
Unlike passenger railway systems, persons in wheelchairs do not have priority access to wheelchair spaces provided on buses, despite this being the only safe space for a person in a wheelchair to travel.

Despite the recent Supreme Court case brought by Doug Paulley, bus drivers have no legal power to force other passengers to move, and can still only request that they do so.

This is detrimental to any person in a wheelchair and has a significant impact on travel.

attributes.action: Stop the use of Juvenile Covert Human Intelligence Sources (child spies).
attributes.background: Currently Juvenile CHIS (child spies) can be used to gather information to do with offences such as gang violence, drug offences and child sexual exploitation. They can be authorised for covert activity for up to one month which the government is trying to increase to 4 months.
attributes.additional_details: The Home office has given no numbers of how many child spies are used, how the risk assessments are carried out and whether the handlers are trained to assess juvenile mental health. The capacity for children to consent to being spies is dubious given they must feel under pressure from an authority figure (the police force) and are vulnerable in a dangerous situation. Refer to 35th Report of Session 2017-2019 of the House of Lords Secondary Legislation Scrutiny Committee.

attributes.action: Tougher sentences for pedophiles and sharing images of child pornography
attributes.background:
We want tougher sentences for pedophiles and the sharing and owning of images of porn a graphic material of children.

Children who suffer abuse are affected in the worst way possible. They don't get to do a sentence then it's all over, they are sentenced to life!
attributes.additional_details: We need to protect our children and break the cycle of abuse by harsh sentences and strict monitoring. At the moment pedophiles get short sentences and probation. This does not deter them from further abusing children.  A child's innocence and trust is gone forever. Their veiw of the world and adults changes in that moment and they'll never ever really feel safe again. Our view of the world is shaped by our early experiences. 25 to Life imprisonment is the only solution to protect our children and stop abuse.

attributes.action: Award a separate medal to recognise the Bomb Disposal Service in WWII
attributes.background: A watercolour began my journey of discovery leading to the heroic acts by the artist Capt. John Hannaford & his colleagues. 350 men were killed defusing, clearing bombs, UXBs, over 50,000 across the UK. Many were killed clearing mines from our beaches. They deserve official recognition.
attributes.additional_details: Capt. Hannaford’s notes, photographs, his in-depth interview at 95 for the IWM with a Channel 4 documentary highlight his belief that the bomb disposal service men and women were forgotten. Footage included other WWII bomb disposal officers telling their heroic story and acts of courage of all their servicemen. Whilst researching I discovered the most powerful evidence was a quote from our great statesman Winston Churchill who said, "Bomb Disposal should be recognised for their dangerous work!"

attributes.action: Urge Iceland to stop killing endangered whales
attributes.background: They have killed endangered Fin and Blue whales. They must stop.

attributes.action: Secretary of State for Northern Ireland should call a Border Poll on Irish unity
attributes.background: The Good Friday Agreement states that the Secretary of State for Northern Ireland must call a border poll on Irish unity if at any time it appears likely that a majority of those voting would express a wish that Northern Ireland should cease to be part of the UK and form part of a united Ireland.
attributes.additional_details:
Unfortunately the Good Friday Agreement does not state exactly how the SoS will judge the wishes of the majority.

We believe the question needs put to the people of NI so either way the discussion can be put to bed.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to charge a single room supplement
attributes.background: This is a petition to ask parliament to make it illegal for hoteliers and tour operators to apply a surcharge to the hotel or holiday booking of anyone travelling on their own. It is routine in the travel industry for a holidaymaker to pay a supplement for occupying a single-bedded hotel room.
attributes.additional_details: I have spoken with several people who often have to travel on their own, many of them believing the supplement to be unfair and unnecessary, especially as there is usually nothing special about the single rooms they are allocated. In my experience, there isn't usually anything exceptional offered in the single room which one could say would attract a surcharge. The rooms are usually tiny, with neither room to "swing a cat", nor a particularly special view outside the window. If you agree that single travellers face unfair discrimination, please sign the petition.

attributes.action: Change the rules for the housing element part of universal credit.
attributes.background:
I am a social landlord who is being affected by the poorly thought out rules for the housing element part of universal credit.
The system was fine under the local councils but so far Universal credit has cost me over 30 weeks in unpaid rent.
Problems for over a year plus now not acceptable!
attributes.additional_details:
Rules that need to be changed ASAP:
1/ Only one office to contact - every time you call you get through to a different centre.
There is no hierarchy chain so you don't get far and there is no accountability.
2/ Speed up call waiting times - 20-30 minutes is too much.
3/ Allow landlords to have the option of being paid directly as standard if they require it.
4/ One journal entry giving landlord permission to access information rather then new journal every time as we don't always live close by.

attributes.action: Make it mandatory for all schools in England to teach fire safety awareness.
attributes.background: Fires cause death and devastation in homes. This highlights the need to educate all children about fire safety awareness in the home. This would help to reduce fires and save lives.
attributes.additional_details: Our Citizenship class decided that something must be done to help people. By making it mandatory for schools in England to teach fire safety awareness in the home, this may help to stop others from losing their lives.

attributes.action: Make Transverse Myelitis recognisable on all life and health insurance policies!
attributes.background: Transverse myelitis is the sister illness to MS! However is unrecognised in mainstream private health and life insurance policies! Which means I can’t protect my family if something happened to me! Please sign the petition to make it a legal requirement to add this illness to the list! Thank you.

attributes.action: Make all trespassing a criminal offence
attributes.background: There has been an uplift of illegal encampments in UK. Recently my council has had to pay out more than one hundred thousand pounds in clean up fees. Trespassers do not respond to civil rulings. To give the police more powers, I propose that all trespassing be made a criminal offence.
attributes.additional_details:
People cannot dictate where they can live by simply by squatting on land they do not own. Police need powers so owners can be protected.

-100K of clean-up from Milton Keynes Council 
-Reported attacks to Police 
-Closing of School sports days https://www.miltonkeynes.co.uk/news/milton-keynes-primary-school-forced-to-cancel-sports-day-after-illegal-travellers-camp-on-field-1-8540123 
https://www.miltonkeynes.co.uk/news/illegal-travellers-camps-causing-problems-in-milton-keynes-1-8524022

attributes.action: Legally require the Net Internal Floor area to be quoted for every home on sale.
attributes.background: Homes in Britain are traded in terms of rooms rather than floor space. This lack of clear information is a source of market failure. British homes are getting more cramped and less fit for purpose.
attributes.additional_details: There are no minimum space standards for new housing in Britain. Research by CABE and LABC Warranty shows that developers are making homes smaller and smaller. New homes lack space for family meals, for childrens play and homework, and for storage. Quoting the Net Internal Floor area (e.g. as defined by the Valuation Office Agency) would help buyers understand exactly what they are getting, make objective comparisons, and identify value for money.

attributes.action: Grant President Donald Trump a full State Visit
attributes.background:
Following President Trump's recent successful visit to our country, the next step should be to allow him the privilege of a full State Visit.

President Trump is the democratically elected President	& as such should be treated with the respect his position holds
attributes.additional_details: We the people of the UK request that President Trump is invited to the UK, given a full state visit, he should also be given the honour of addressing Parliament and the people of the UK.

attributes.action: Life sentence for causing death by dangerous driving, including first offences
attributes.background: July 1st 2017 was the day my 17 year old brother, Stephen, was killed due to dangerous driving. The driver was on multiple drugs as well as being fuelled with alcohol. The car they had was not theirs, they had no insurance, no tax and no licence! They also seriously injured a young girl.
attributes.additional_details: The offender was not sentenced until 9 months after Stephen’s death. During this time we didn’t see the offender show any remorse. They appeared to be out partying, drinking and taking drugs. The offender was sentenced to just 8 years in prison and because they pleaded guilty, they got a third knocked off this sentence and because it was a first offence the sentence will be reduced by further third.

attributes.action: Put up a statue of Margaret Thatcher outside Parliament
attributes.background: Caroline Criado Perez launched an online petition in 2016 after noticing there were no statues of women outside Parliament. There is no better example of a woman than Margaret Thatcher, the first female prime minister of the UK of nearly 12 years.

attributes.action: Stop Myxomatosis killing wild Rabbits by developing a lifetime vaccine
attributes.background: Myxomatosis is cruel disease which millions of wild rabbits in the UK die from each year. It is not acceptable that such a disease is left unchecked due to it being released illegally in the UK in the 1950’s. Myxomatosis is pure torture for any wild rabbit infected.
attributes.additional_details: They suffer severe conjunctivitis that results in blindness, swelling in the head, ears, eyes and genitals, thick pus discharge from the nose (which makes it difficult to breathe), and lumps on the body for up to two weeks before they die; longer in many cases. Rabbits are sentient beings, who feel pain and suffer every bit as any other animal. I want the Government to actively discuss all the options open to it to combat/control this disease in the wild rabbit population.

attributes.action: Require hospitals to provide sufficient free staff parking for nurses
attributes.background: My friend, an amazing nurse, is forced to pay £24 per week to park at the hospital she works for. She only works 16hrs, yet a substantial percentage of her pay is used enabling her JUST to GO to work. Nurses are already ridiculously underpaid for their role in saving lives. How can this be fair?
attributes.additional_details: The NHS, particularly hospitals, are one of if not the busiest body of workers in the UK. Nurses work tirelessly 24 hours a day, 7 days a week to provide a service that treats over 1 million patients in just 36 hours. There is a critical shortage of nurses with 1 in 11 NHS posts currently unfilled. Nurses are important, and it makes no sense to charge them to be able to simply go into work. It’s unfair, its uneconomical, and it is clearly not helping in people staying within NHS employment.

attributes.action: Make Asthma inhalers free, like other medicines are for other ailments
attributes.background: As seen in the news people including children die from Asthma attacks.
attributes.additional_details: I know a few people and as seen on the news people of all ages are dying from Asthma attacks. Not everyone uses preventative inhalers due to the prescription costs. Why do diabetics get free prescriptions and other illnesses that can't be helped, but not asthma sufferers? This is a killer and inhalers should be free.

attributes.action: Set a legal minimum requirement for hamster cages
attributes.background: RSPCA recommend that a Syrian Hamster should have a cage with 80 x 50cm unbroken floor space. However this is not defined in law so pet shops can sell 50 x 60cm cages as LARGE hamster cages. Your small pets live stressed and unhappy lives, while you think you’ve bought a sufficient cage.
attributes.additional_details: Parliament should change the law so that it specifically includes this minimum cage size for hamsters. This would make it an offence to sell and use cages for hamsters which don’t meet this size.
